utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Hey. Hold on a second. Huh?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Nice, nice. Hey I got somethin' for you. [hands Chandler an envelope.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: What's this?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Eight hundred and twelve bucks.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Well, I don't know what Big Leon told ya but it's an even thousand if you want me for the whole night. What is this for?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Well, I'm makin money now and this is payin' you back for head shots, electric bills, and so many slices of pizza I can't even count. I love ya man.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Well, thanks man. Now I can get my pony.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Hey, this is a little extra somethin' for uh, ya know, always bein' there for me.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Wow, I don't know what to say. Wow, I, I don't know what to say.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Heh, what d'ya say?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: I don't know. It's a bracelet.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Isn't it? And it's engraved too, check it out.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: To my best bud. Thanks best bud.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Put it on.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Oh, now? No, no, I think something this nice should be saved for a special occasion.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Oh, no no, that's the beauty part, it goes with everything. You put this on, you're good to go. Ohhh man, you are so wearin' that bracelet.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: I so am.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: You have any idea what this'll do for your sex life?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Well, it'll probably slow it down at first but, once I get used to the extra weight, I'll be back on track.

utterance.speaker: INTERVIEWER
utterance.content: Well, this all looks good.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Great.

utterance.speaker: INTERVIEWER
utterance.content: And if I want to call for a reference on your last job?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Oh, that's there on the bottom, see the manager, Chandler Bing.

utterance.speaker: INTERVIEWER
utterance.content: Alright, lets see if you're as good in person as you are on paper. Make me a salad.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: A salad? Really I, I could do something a little more complicated if you like.

utterance.speaker: INTERVIEWER
utterance.content: No, just a salad will be fine.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: You got it.

utterance.speaker: INTERVIEWER
utterance.content: Now, I want you to tell me what you're doing while you're doing it.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Alright, well I'm tearing the lettuce.

utterance.speaker: INTERVIEWER
utterance.content: Uh-huh. Is it dirty?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Oh-oh, no no don't worry, I'm gonna wash it.

utterance.speaker: INTERVIEWER
utterance.content: Don't, I like it dirty.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: That's your call.

utterance.speaker: INTERVIEWER
utterance.content: So, uh, what are you going to do next?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Well, I thought that I would cut up the tomatos.

utterance.speaker: INTERVIEWER
utterance.content: Are they, uh, firm?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: They'r alright.

utterance.speaker: INTERVIEWER
utterance.content: You sure they haven't gone bad? You're sure they're not very, very bad?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: No really, they're OK.

utterance.speaker: INTERVIEWER
utterance.content: You gonna slice them up real nice?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Actually, I was gonna do them jullienne.

utterance.speaker: INTERVIEWER
utterance.content: Aaaahhhhhhh.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: I'm outa here.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Y-ello. No, Rachel's not here right now, can I take a message? Alright, and how do we spell Casey, is it like at the bat or and the Sunshine Band? OK, bye-bye. Hey, who's this uh, this Casey?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Oh, some guy she met at the movies.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Oh really? What uh, what does he want with her?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Well, I'm guessing he wants to do a little dance. . . ya know, make a little love. . . well pretty much get down tonight.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: I don't know, I don't get, I don't get it, I mean, wh, wh, two months ago Rachel and I were like, this close. Right now, what, I'm takin messages from guys she, she meets at the movies? I mean this, this Casey should be takin' down my messages, ya know, or, or, Rachel and I should be together and, and we should get some kind of me, message service.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Hang in there, it's gonna happen.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Wha, OK, now how do you know that?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Because she's your lobster.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Oh, she's goin' somewhere.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: C'mon you guys. It's a known fact that lobsters fall in love and mate for life. You know what, you can actually see old lobster couples walkin' around their tank, ya know, holding claws like. . .

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Hey, you feelin' better?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Yeah, I think that fifth shower actually got the interview off me.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: So, do you have any other possibilities?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Oh yeah, well there's the possibility that I won't make rent.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Monica, if you want, I can lend you some money.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: No no no, if I couldn't pay you back right away then I'd feel guilty and tense every time I saw you.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Oh OK. Well then why don't you, uhh, why don't you borrow it from mom and dad? You feel guilty and tense around them already. You might as well make some money off of them.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Ya know, the man's got a point.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: What is that sparkly thing?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: That thing, it's a uhh. . . yeah it's, it's a little flashy.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: No no, no no, it's not flashy, not for a Goodfella.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Man, man that is sharp. It must have cost you quite a few debloons.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: MR. GELLER
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: MRS. GELLER
utterance.content: Hi darling.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: So, what's this.

utterance.speaker: MR. GELLER
utterance.content: Some of your old stuff.

utterance.speaker: MRS. GELLER
utterance.content: Well sweetie, we have a surprise for you. We're turning your room into a gym.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Wow, that is a surprise. Just one little question, uh, why not Ross's room?

utterance.speaker: MR. GELLER
utterance.content: Gosh, we talked about that but your brother has so many science trophies and plaques and merit badges, well we didn't want to disturb them.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Oh, God forbid.

utterance.speaker: MRS. GELLER
utterance.content: Oh, hi Rachel.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: MRS. GELLER
utterance.content: Oh, we were so sorry to hear about your parents splitting up, dear.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Oh, well, you know, they're just separated so, you know, never know, we'll see.

utterance.speaker: MR. GELLER
utterance.content: Well, I can't say any of us were surprised. Your parents have been unhappy ever since we've known them. Especially after that incident in Hawaii.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: What, what incident?

utterance.speaker: MR. GELLER
utterance.content: Uhh, naa, no no no, I, I must be thinking of someone else, uh, maybe me. Don't you have some folding to do? Go fold dear. Fold. You fold.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Do you want a refill?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: No, I'm alright, thanks.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: OK. Ooh, OK, you gotta give me a second, I wanna get this just right. Dude, 11 o'clock, totally hot babe checkin' you out. That was really good, I think I'm ready for my penis now.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: I know what you're thinking, Dave Thomas, founder of Wendy's.

utterance.speaker: GAIL
utterance.content: I'm Gail.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Chandler.

utterance.speaker: GAIL
utterance.content: I, I really have to be somewhere but it was nice meeting you.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: What? Oh this is excellent. You know he coulda gotten me a VCR, he coulda gotten me a set of golf clubs, but no, he has to get me the woman repeller, the eyesore from the Liberace house of crap.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: It's not that bad.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Oh, yeah, easy for you to say, you don't have to walk around sporting some reject from the Mr. T collection.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Chandler, Chandler.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: I pity the fool who puts on my jewelry, I do, I do. I pity the fool that. . . Hi. Hey man, we were just doin' some uhh, impressions over here. Do your Marcel Marceau. That's actually good.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Would you look at that guy, I mean how long has he been talking to her. It's like, back off buddy she's a waitress not a geisha.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: I think she's OK.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Look at that, look at that, see how she's pushing him away and he won't budge. Alright, I'm gonna do something. Excuse me, are you Rachel?

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: I'm Ross Geller. Wha, I'm, God in your add you said you were pretty but wow.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: What are you, what are you doin'?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Oh, oh my God, is this the wrong day? I don't believe it, uh, well, hey, I guess if it works out we'll, we'll have something to tell the grandkids.

utterance.speaker: MAN
utterance.content: Sure will. I've uh, gotta go. Take care.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: OK, see ya later, nice meeting you. You're welcome.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: I was saving you.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Saving, saving, saving me from the pleasant conversation with the interesting man, saving me?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Oh, see from where I was sitting I uh. . .

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: OK, Ross, listen to me, I am not yours to save.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: But, you are.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Uh, uh, well you're, umm, you're my lobster.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: OK, you know what, are, are you being like, the blind date guy again?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: No no, you're uh, you're my lobster. See um, lobsters, uhh, in the tank when, when they're old, uhh, they get with, uhh, they walk around holding the claws. In the tank, ya know, with, with the holding and. . . Uhh, Phoebs you wanna help me out with the, the whole lobster thing?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Do the claws again.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Rach. OK, forget, forget the lobsters OK. We're, let's talk, what about us?

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Ross, there is no us, OK.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: No, but. . .

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: No, listen to me. I fell for you and I get clobbered. You then fall for me and I again, somehow, get clobbered. I'm tired of being clobbered, ya know, it's, it's just not worth it.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Well, but, but. . .

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: NO but Ross. We are never gonna happen, OK. Accept that.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: E-except, except that what?

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: No, no, ACC-cept that.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Hey man, look it's my best bud. How ya doin? Wow, you are really gettin' good at that Marcel Marceau thing. Hey, whaddya say uh, we play some ball, you and me, huh, whaddya say? OK, that's my bad.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: If you hated the bracelet so much, Chandler, you should have just said so.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Well, doesn't the fact that I wore the bracelet even though I hated it say something about our friendship and how much it means to me?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Well, what about the fact that you insulted the bracelet and you made fun of me?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: You know what the. . .

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: I am here, on my knees, holding up these couch cushions as a symbol of my sorrow and regret, much like they did in biblical times. Though you may haveth anger now. . .

utterance.speaker: MR. GELLER
utterance.content: You know, that Steffi Graf has quite a tush. I'm just saying, it's right there.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Hey guys.

utterance.speaker: MRS. GELLER
utterance.content: Hi, darling. Where's my grandson, you didn't bring him?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: No, he's at uh, Carol's and Susan's today.

utterance.speaker: MR. GELLER
utterance.content: A woman in my office is a lesiban. I'm just saying.

utterance.speaker: MRS. GELLER
utterance.content: Oh, Jack look, there's that house paint commercial that cracks you up.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Where have you been?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Emotional hell. So, did they lend you the money yet?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: No, but that's probably 'cause I haven't asked them yet.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: C'mon Monica, do it. Hey, you guys, um, Monica has some news.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Um, yeah, so uh, uhh, listen, I'm sorry I didn't tell you this before but umm, I, I'm no longer at my job, I, I had to leave it.

utterance.speaker: MRS. GELLER
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Because they made me.

utterance.speaker: MRS. GELLER
utterance.content: You were fired? What're you gonna do?

utterance.speaker: MR. GELLER
utterance.content: Judy, Judy, relax, this is our little harmonica we're talking about. We taught her well. Ten percent of your paycheck, where does it go?

utterance.speaker: MONICA and ROSS
utterance.content: In the bank.

utterance.speaker: MR. GELLER
utterance.content: There you go. So she dips into her savings, that's what it's there for. She's gonna be fine, and if you need a little extra, you know where to find it.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Anything larger back there?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: I can't believe it.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Would you stop already? Get out of the bitter barn and play in the hay.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Oh, you're right I, I should play in the hay. Forget about the fact that I just dropped 400 dollars to replace a bracelet that I hated to begin with. Bring on the hay.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Hey. I've got something that's gonna make you happy. Guess what Gunther found?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Hey now you have two. Oh, now you have two.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: What am I gonna do, huh?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: How come you have two?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Well this one's for you.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Get out.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: No, I can't. No no, listen, I, I know how much this means to you and I also know that this is about more than just jewelry, it's about you and me and the fact that we're best buds.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Wow, is this friendship? I think so. Check it out, we're bracelet buddies.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: That's what they'll call us.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Here you go, you can pay me back whenever you like.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: You have dinosaur checks?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah I mean, you get your money and you learn a little something, what's wrong with that?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Nothin', nothin', hey you're a cheapasaurus. I'm kidding, I'm kidding, thank you, I'm very greatful.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Oh, um, that was my bathing suit from high school. I was uh, a little bigger then.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Oh, I thought that's what they used to cover Connecticut when it rained.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Hey Monica, what's on this video tape?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Hey, you got me, put it in.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.content: Over here Jack. OK. I see, Rachel's coming up the path. Oh doesn't she look pretty. Jack, get this.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Oh my God.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: What is with your nose?

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: They had to reduce it because of, of my deviated septum.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: OK, I was wrong, that's what they used to cover Connecticut.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: You know what this is, this is us getting ready for the prom.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: You know what, you guys, we don't have to watch this.

utterance.speaker: ALL
utterance.content: Oh yeah we do. C'mon.

utterance.speaker: MRS. GELLER
utterance.content: Get a shot of Monica. Where's Monica.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Over here dad.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Some girl ate Monica.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Shut up, the camera adds ten pounds.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Ahh, so how many cameras are actually on you?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Oh, you look so great.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Ahh, so do you, beautiful.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Oops.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Shoot, I think I got mayonaise on you.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Oh, that's OK, it's just the shoulder, it's not my dress.

utterance.speaker: MR. GELLER
utterance.content: Everybody smile.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Oh, dad, turn it off.

utterance.speaker: MR. GELLER
utterance.content: It is off.

utterance.content: Dad, it is not. What's with the red light?

utterance.content: It's the off light. Right Ross?

utterance.speaker: JOEY

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: You look pretty tonight.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Oh, thanks. So, uh, what are you gonna do this summer?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Oh, you know, I'm just gonna, I'm gonna hang out, work on my music.

utterance.content: Is my hook unhooked? These things keep falling down, I can't. . .

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Uh, hold, let me see, I don't know. So what're you gonna do. . .

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Oh, the guys are here.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: this summer?

utterance.content: Work on your music?

utterance.content: Oh my God, look there's Roy Gublik.

utterance.content: Where's Chip, why isn't he here yet?

utterance.content: He'll be here OK, take a chill pill.

utterance.speaker: MONICA

utterance.content: Oh, I'm gonna kick Chip's ass.

utterance.content: Well, c'mon. Don't ya want to find out?
